New Records: Kusal Perera played wonderfully and slammed the fastest half-century of ICC World Cup 2023 on just 21 balls.
Key Match Events: Trent Boult clinched 3 crucial wickets as he dismissed Kusal Mendis, Sadeera Samarawickrama and Charith Asalanka
Lockie Ferguson clinched the big wicket of Kusal Perera, who was looking dangerous today
Spinner Mitchell Santner clinched Angelo Mathews and Dhananjaya de Silva's wicket
Pacer Lockie Ferguson dismissed Chamika Karunaratne and 8 wickets are down for Sri Lanka
WICKET!! Devon Conway (45) departs on the second delivery of Dushmantha Chameera in the 13th over.
WICKET!! Rachin Ravindra (42) dismissed on the third ball of the 14th over by Maheesh Theekshana
WICKET!! Angelo Mathews dismisses Kane Williamson (14) on the second delivery of the 19th over.
WICKET!! Mark Chapman (7) RUN OUT on the third delivery of 21st over by Samarawickrama and Mathews.
New Zealand thrashed Sri Lanka by 5 wickets with 160 balls remaining and inch closer in ensuring a semi-final berth.
Trent Boult becomes ‘Player of the Match’
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand and Sri Lanka met 101 times in ODIs. New Zealand lead with 51 wins to Sri Lanka's 41 while 8 games have been inconclusive, and one ended in a tie.
Post-Match Reflections: Following this win, the Black Caps have inched closer to semi-finals with 10 points in 9 matches and a net runrate of (+)0.743.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka continued to loose wickets as no partnership evolved for the team.
In the first 10 overs, half of Sri Lanka's batting order was sitting in the dugout as Trent Boult clinched 3 wickets while Tim Southee and Lockie Ferguson took one wicket each.
